msbt.message: Hello, ! Turkey Day is here at last!I'm so excited to see what our chef has on the menu, .
It's such a treat to see Franklin feeding me personally. Aren't you excited, ?!
Turkey Day is in full swing. Some folks are busy cooking at home, but I wanted to see Franklin in person.
So Franklin is going to cook up some dishes with local ingredients?And he's got you fetching the ingredients for him? What an honor! Now I'm even more eager for a taste!

Does Franklin have you hunting down ingredients for his dishes?I wish there was some way I could help out. Oh! You know, some folks stayed home to do a little cooking.Our amateur chefs might have some hard-to-find ingredients that the pro in the plaza could use. Everyone on will be happy to pitch in when it comes to Turkey Day, !
What an aroma! I'm never hungrier than when Franklin's in town. I'd eat anything from him, .
This food looks so appetizing. There's plenty to study here for my own stabs at plating.
What a spread! I feel full just looking at it all, .
Everything is on the table now! It all looks so good that I don't know where to start, .
The food is ready, so I'd say this Turkey Day is a big success!It all looks and smells so wonderful that I almost hate to eat it! To be clear, I'm still going to.
Turkey Day never fails to put a smile on my face. I wonder what's next on the menu, .

See how he uses different spices and degrees of heat to really bring out the taste? Franklin knows his stuff!Of course, he couldn't get results like that if he wasn't already using the finest ingredients, .
I need to pace myself. I hear there's more food to come! Oooh, I'm so excited to see the next course!
Every meal here is cooked to perfection. I couldn't ask for better, !Who knew such quality ingredients were to be found here? It makes me proud to live on .
When a first-rate chef uses the local ingredients from , the result speaks for itself.My stomach and heart are stuffed. What a beautiful Turkey Day this has been!
It's a dream come true to get to eat food this good.Maybe I should wrap some up and bring it home so Turkey Day can last just a little bit longer.
That sure looks tasty.That was you who provided the , right? Thanks so much! I can't wait to dig in.
The was made with local !I bet that's why it smells so great But what am I saying? You ought to know—you brought it!
That sure looks tasty.That was you who provided the manila clams, right? Thanks so much! I can't wait to dig in.
The was made with local manila clams!I bet that's why it smells so great But what am I saying? You ought to know—you brought them!
I was hoping I could contribute some of my own cooking to Turkey Day.I might not be on Franklin's level, but I can't sit around the plaza all day. I've got to do something to help!
It's Turkey Day at last!I've been looking forward to this chance to strut my stuff in the kitchen. I intend to go all out!
How's everything going in the plaza, ?I ought to find a moment to go visit, but there's so much cooking to do right here.
What can I do that'll really show off my skills? Oh! Sorry about that. I have a lot of feelings about cooking.
I'm glad you're here! I was getting anxious because I couldn't find any for this dish.If you happen to get your hands on some, I'll trade you for another ingredient. Does that sound good?
Oh? Is that I smell?I could really use a pinch of for this dishIf you wouldn't mind parting with yours, I'd be happy to give you another ingredient in return.
Sure!
I don't know...
It was worth a try. It's OK. I know how precious that ingredient is.But if you have a bit extra on hand, I'd be happy to trade, .
This dish isn't going to taste right without some . But where am I going to get that?
I've got some for you!
Sorry, can't help you.
I'm short on the I need for this dish. Isn't that always the way?It would mean a lot to me if I could borrow some from you. I'll give you something from my pantry in return!
Let's trade!
I don't have any.
Oh, I didn't mean to impose! Sorry. If you end up with extra at any point, I'd be very grateful to have some.
Can't hurt to ask, I guess. If you do end up with a little extra, please think of me, !
Oh?! No deal, huh?
Oh, umI actually needed a little bit of .You can have this back. When you do have to spare, drop by again, OK? .
Thanks a million! This will be such a big help.Hmm What should I give you in return? Oh! I do have some extra . Will that do?

What a relief that I had something you could use! At least, I hope you have a use for this ingredientLet me also give you a tip about ingredients to really spice up your cooking. Use it in good health!
You can add shells other than manila clams to clam chowder and it'll still taste good.For instance, scallops have a nice flavor. You'd be surprised what they can do for your dish, .
You can add larger clams than manilas to your clam chowder for some extra volume.There's a certain large bivalve whose name escapes me I'm sure you know the one I mean, .
If you're making pumpkin pie, a good variety of pumpkins helps to keep every bite interesting.I recommend 4 kinds of pumpkin. That'll make for a pie folks will come back to for seconds and thirds!
If you're making pumpkin pie, a good variety of pumpkins helps to keep every bite interesting.Use a bunch of different colors of pumpkins for a pie to remember. It works every time, .

Gratin is good no matter what you put in it, but crab is a good accent to its taste if you want to be daring. You know what makes for a really rich-tasting gratin? A high-quality Dungeness crab. It's quite a delicacy!

You can put anything in gratin, but I think crab is tastiest. A good, meaty crab can solve lots of problems.A saltwater crab is better for gratin. There's one that's on the tip of my tongue. What was it again
Pretty much any kind of whitefish goes with fish meunière.But you can really dazzle 'em by using something out of the ordinary like barred knifejaw, !
Whitefish is key in fish meunière, but it would be nice to find one that has a different texture to it.I bet a saltwater fish would have just the right feel for the dish you're making, .

Thanks so much for sharing your ingredients with me. They were so fresh and delicious!Thanks to that, all the dishes I made turned out just as I hoped. Or maybe even better! thought so too, which is why I don't have any left to offer you
Thanks for sharing your ingredients with me today, .This is a Turkey Day to remember!
I hear all the dishes in the plaza are ready to eat. Maybe I can take a quick taste-test break, .
If practice makes perfect, then I made enough food today to become a master chef!I wonder if the real pros also get noodle arms after a long day in the kitchen, .
The reward for a day spent cooking is the satisfaction of a job well done.There are still recipes on my list I didn't get to though Maybe next year, .
We're celebrating Turkey Day here on .It's the perfect excuse to hole up in my kitchen and cook all day long, !
You picked a good day to visit!I hope you enjoy our Turkey Day festivities. Eat, drink, and be merry, as they say!
I do love to cook, but an all-day kitchen marathon takes a lot out of you.Lifting those heavy pots filled with water is a real workout. I'm going to be sore tomorrow, .
I feel like I got to know everyone on better through the food we shared today!It's days like this that make me thankful to live here, with all the bounty nature has to offer us.
Turkey Day was so much fun. I'm glad I decided to move to this island.I look forward to an even bigger Turkey Day on next year, !
I definitely had my fill of good food today. Both cooking it and eating it!The aroma's still lingering in my kitchen. I think I'll be feasting well into my dreams tonight!
I had a blast this Turkey Day!The folks who livened up the plaza, the folks who stayed home cooking I'm thankful for them all.
What a Turkey Day!So many delicious dishes I wouldn't mind if we did this more often!Well, maybe that's going overboard. But I'm already looking forward to next year, !
All the dishes were great. Let's just say I went back for more than seconds.And you know what? I think I'll be having another course in my dreams tonight, .
The food in the plaza was lovely. It fed me down to my soul, if that makes sense. I love Turkey Day!Fresh ingredients, good meals, a nice day with my neighbors Yep, this is one for the diary, .
